research_method: Web search via Google (Bright Data Browser connection issues)

landmarks.name: Oak Ridge Chamber of Commerce
landmarks.address: 1400 Oak Ridge Turnpike, Oak Ridge, TN 37830
landmarks.description: Four-star Accredited Chamber of Commerce serving over 500 members since 1949. Winner of ACCE 2010 Chamber of the Year designation.
landmarks.significance: Voice of business for Oak Ridge community

landmarks.name: Jackson Square
landmarks.description: Historic business center with eclectic shops, restaurants, Oak Ridge Playhouse, and lush gardens. Part of Oak Ridge Historic District on National Register of Historic Places since 1991.
landmarks.history: Served as primary commercial center and social hub since 1945 (originally Town Center No. 1)
landmarks.significance: Used as model for planned communities like Reston, Virginia

landmarks.name: Main Street Oak Ridge
landmarks.address: Main Street Oak Ridge, Oak Ridge, TN 37830
landmarks.description: Mixed-use development featuring national retailers including Dick's Sporting Goods, T.J. Maxx, Belk, JCPenney, Electronic Express, PetSmart, and Rack Room Shoes.
landmarks.history: Formerly Oak Ridge Mall, redeveloped in 2016-2017

landmarks.name: Oak Ridge Economic Development Initiative
landmarks.description: Leading economic development for Oak Ridge's tech sector. City experienced 308% growth in housing units permitted in 2022, with over $28M in capital investments in 2021.
landmarks.significance: International success story since DOE's reindustrialization program launched in 1996

landmarks.name: Tennessee Small Business Development Center - Oak Ridge
landmarks.address: 1400 Oak Ridge Turnpike, Oak Ridge, TN 37830
landmarks.description: Provides high-quality consulting and training solutions to start, grow and sustain businesses.

strategic_advantages: Over 70% of US marketplace within a day's drive
Convergence of three major interstate highways (I-40, I-75, I-81)
Home to Department of Energy facilities

landmarks.name: Sevierville Chamber of Commerce
landmarks.description: Chamber and Convention and Visitors Bureau serving Sevierville since 1963. Promotes tourism and business networking for 5,540 businesses.
landmarks.significance: Tourism marketing arm for City of Sevierville

landmarks.name: Sevierville Convention Center
landmarks.description: 108,245 sq ft exhibit hall with 1,571 parking spaces. ConventionSouth's Annual Readers' Choice Award winner. Adjacent to Wilderness at the Smokies Waterpark Resort.
landmarks.significance: Perfect for sporting events, trade shows, conventions

landmarks.name: Downtown Sevierville Historic District
landmarks.description: Downtown historic district centered around Sevier County Courthouse. Hosts annual Bloomin' BBQ Music & Food Festival.
landmarks.significance: County seat and birthplace of Dolly Parton

landmarks.name: Winfield Dunn Parkway (Highway 66) Commercial Corridor
landmarks.description: Major commercial corridor with in-season average daily traffic of 70,000+ vehicles. Gateway to Great Smoky Mountains National Park.
landmarks.significance: Attracts tourists and local customers, serves 10+ million annual park visitors

landmarks.name: Dolly Parton Parkway (Highway 441)
landmarks.description: Major commercial development corridor connecting Sevierville to Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg.
landmarks.significance: Primary tourist route to the Smokies

strategic_advantages: Gateway to Great Smoky Mountains National Park
Within day's drive of over half the nation's population

landmarks.name: Gatlinburg Chamber of Commerce
landmarks.description: Chamber and CVB serving Gatlinburg since 1940. Officially chartered as non-profit in June 1957. Manages Gatlinburg Vacation Guide and visitor inquiries.
landmarks.history: Began as tourist bureau in late 1930s, chartered by U.S. Chamber of Commerce in 1940
landmarks.significance: Gateway to Great Smoky Mountains National Park (14 million annual visitors)

landmarks.name: Gatlinburg Convention Center
landmarks.description: 148,000 sq ft of flexible meeting and exhibit space in downtown Gatlinburg. Features Great Hall (67,000 sq ft), Tennessee Ballroom (17,064 sq ft), and Mills Auditorium (8,800 sq ft).
landmarks.significance: Within walking distance to downtown attractions, restaurants, and 16,000+ sleeping rooms

landmarks.name: Downtown Gatlinburg Parkway
landmarks.description: Central downtown district with shops, restaurants, attractions, and hotels. Main corridor through Gatlinburg.

landmarks.name: Great Smoky Arts & Crafts Community
landmarks.address: Off Highway 321 North, Glades Road/Buckhorn Road, Gatlinburg, TN
landmarks.description: Largest independent organization of artisans in the United States. 8-mile loop featuring 120+ shops with traditional Appalachian crafts. Established in 1937.
landmarks.significance: Preserves traditional Appalachian craftsmanship, hosts Gatlinburg Craftsmen's Fair and Winterfest light displays

landmarks.name: Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts
landmarks.address: Historic campus in downtown Gatlinburg on edge of Great Smoky Mountains National Park
landmarks.description: Immersive arts experience on historic campus offering art classes, workshops, and cultural experiences.
landmarks.significance: Preserves and promotes traditional and contemporary crafts

gatlinburg.park_visitors: 14 million annual visitors to Great Smoky Mountains National Park
strategic_advantages: Gateway to most visited national park in USA
Within walking distance of downtown attractions
Largest independent arts and crafts community in USA
Prime location at base of Great Smoky Mountains

regional_context.tourism_significance: Great Smoky Mountains National Park gateway region with 10-14 million annual visitors
regional_context.business_environment: Tourism-based economy with strong small business presence across all three cities
